Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with private rooftop garden for budget prices!”
Reviews.Author: sileb
Reviews.Content: This place was about a 3 min walk past the designer boutiques (Chanel, Burberry, Prada etc) to the main square/ Plaza at the top of Las Ramblas. The hotel is a beautiful old building with traditional Barcelona styled architecture, but inside its sleek and ultra modern. We booked it as a secret hotel (although the description gave it away) on last minute.com so it was a great price! I've stayed here twice, once at the back of the hotel and once at the front, both room were lovely but the one at the front was stunning, and had its own private rooftop garden with seating so we could sit out in the evening with a bottle of wine in total privacy and stunning views (Sacra de familia an be seen in the distance). Will definitely be returning! Truly luxurious an stylish!

Reviews.Title: “great location for walking to all sites”
Reviews.Author: lilivou
Reviews.Content: This a small modern hotel that has a great location for walking to all areas of Barcelona ,the ramblas,gothic area,cathedrals,familia sagrada,etc...about 15 minutes in any direction . Has lots of small restaurants and tapa places nearby to eat both at night and breakfast( onlybuffet breakfast at 14 eruosp/p..nothing special). Staff are rather brusque but accomplish what you ask for(without a smile) Rooms are a decent size as well as modern bathroom BUT the beds are the hardest ones you'll ever sleep on!!! Left with lower back pain. Back rooms are quiet but face inner courtyard and other rooms so you cannot open the blinds. Would I go back ? Not unless the beds are changed! Liliana

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ethem_E_85
Reviews.Content: Situated in the beautiful Eixample district, the hotel is only a 5 minute walk to the mesmerising Passeig de Gracia which really is the heart and soul of Barcelona. Great location, great rooms, average staff, Fantastic price. Only bad point is the staff at the reception desk were never too helpful which is a shame as its a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very hard bed!”
Reviews.Author: tiger077
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish hotel in a good location.The room we had was at the back of the hotel and was a good size with a very good bathroom, although on the last morning there was no hot water! The view from our window was the back of some flats and a basketball court. The problem with the room was the bed, I have stayed in dozens of hotels and this is the hardest bed I have ever encountered! I think the person in the room above must have had a similar bed as they walked around the room the entire night, not great for quality of sleep. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food. There are lots of little cafes around the hotel that do coffee and croissant etc.for around 2 euros so no need to have breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A basic boutique in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: strawberry_501
Reviews.Content: Barcelona 987 doesn't disappoint as a basic 4 star boutique hotel. Located a 15 minute walk from Sagrada Familia (tip- go in the afternoon as there's less of a line up) and 10 minutes from the high end shopping strip on the Passeig de Gracia. These are also the closest hop on/off bus stations which is arguably the best way to travel around this city for first timers. Metro station is close too. The rooms are large with 2 twin beds pushed together. I have conceded this is the standard in Europe which worked out perfectly fine as I travelled with my mum. Very clean and fitted was ikea-like furniture and the storage was fine unless you plan to stay 5 days plus. Beds were hard but comfortable nonetheless. Sparse no frills toiletry so BYO. No English channels and temperamental wifi. Made things like checking the weather difficult but we survived! Good breakfast was provided as part of our Voyage Prive package. 3 nights and return BA flights from Heathrow for £320 each. A good deal that we booked back in January. Transfers are expensive from the airport ~ €50 taxi ride. Next time, I would probably catch the aerobes then a taxi now that I know my way around the city better. Tapas restaurant near the hotel (opposite corner) is worth a visit. Mussels restaurant next door is not! I recommend this hotel for those who are happy to be in a quieter spot and looking for a genuinely good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be conned by the 'Superior Rooms'”
Reviews.Author: HiddenValleyYurts
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with 9 friends for my husband's 60th birthday. Great location and for the money it was good value - but having paid for a superior room (it was his birthday after all!) we found that our friends had much larger rooms with far nicer bathrooms and decoration. When we queried this we were told it was because we had a terrace...well, yes we did but so did our friends and they paid standard. Bearing in mind we had brought 6 rooms worth of business at a low season time of year, it wouldn't have hurt 987 to make sure the birthday boy had a nice pad. The rooms are very funky - but no storage for clothes other than open shelves. Good location and nice and clean though.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK.”
Reviews.Author: Swava
Reviews.Content: Nearly everything is fine about this hotel. It's centrally located, clean, comfortable and stylish. The only downside was the staff that could have been more present... but this was something very cosmetic and didn't bother me. Overall, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 3/4 days stay”
Reviews.Author: Blackpool
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very obliging from order a taxi to chasing up the transfer back to the airport at the end of our stay. Very clean Hotel and the room was ideal for the duration. The breakfast room was again very clean and tidy and the staff were happy in their work and most Polite. The food was hot/buffet style which was plentiful and self service. The hotel was easy accessable to all the attractions including the open top bus. Be careful in the market and other confined areas for dippers but simple prevention helps to protect. Keep things out of sight and nothing in jacket pockets.

Reviews.Title: “cool but pretentious”
Reviews.Author: clareymary82
Reviews.Content: This was a weekend break, to explore the beautiful City of Barcelona. The Hotel is well situated about 800 metres from the main thoroughfare. First impressions of the Hotel were very favourable, - it is a boutique style, cool and trendy hotel housed in a great modernista building and the blend of old and new really works well. However, look beyond the surface and a few cracks begin to show. There is quite a bit of cosmetic damage to public areas, holes in walls etc, and some of the "cool" accessories are in fact quite tacky - made of plastic, and lacking in quality. The room was fine - great nights sleep on really comfy beds, and the breakfast buffet was excellent too. The staff were ok, - not particularly friendly, and seemed a bit too interested in their mobile phones which was distracting, but overall this is a good, central place to stay in the most vibrant and fantastic City you could wish for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GijsvK
Reviews.Content: I was given a room on the top floor, with a nice balcony looking out at the Sagrada Familia. The room itself was quite small, as in many Eixample hotels, but well designed. Breakfast was ok and the staff were friendly. Wifi was free but I couldn't get it to work reliably.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rafael_rio
Reviews.Content: 987 Barcelona provided me a great experience in general. Great hotel, very good prices and excellent location. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SamWilcox-Diedericks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel whilst on business from the 10th February 2012 to the 13th February 2012. The Location on Carrer de Mallorca was very good. This is three blocks from the Passeig de Gracia and really close to Gaudi's Casa Battlo and the Sagrada Familia. It also a good 15 minute walk to the Placa Catalunya - this is a good thing as it is well removed from all the pick pockets and chaos of that area. The lobby of the hotel is impressive and spacious. The rooms are generously sized and have a good layout. It also has everything that you need. Even the room service menu is well priced by European standards. The bathroom is great - with the most fantastic shower, and again space. The only downside of the hotel was the following: The staff at reception can best be described as sullen. Honestly no-one is going to ask you how it is going or if they can be of any assistance. There are no porters to help with bags to the room - but hey, there was a trolley available for this. The guy behind reception calmly watched as I loaded my heavy bags onto the trolley and struggled to get it into the lift. There is no iron or ironing board available - so it cost 8 euro to have a jacket pressed via the laundry service. Breakfast is not included - and although lovely, it does cost 14 euro. Overall it is a great hotel - it would be a brilliant 4 star and a far happier hotel, if they jacked up the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Could have the lot!”
Reviews.Author: NormalGuy40
Reviews.Content: When a place is potentailly this good, the weak points make a disproportionate impact. The good points include its location - 25 minutes walk to the gothic cathedral (Basilica), 15 minutes walk to The Ramblas, Sagrada Familia, 5 minutes walk to Casa Batllo, La Predera and City Tour buses (excellent value), and Metro. Breakfast in a light and airy dining area (outside in summer) is excellent and extensive, bedrooms (ours was a standard double with firm bed) was spacious and clean, with minibar and safe. Recepton is staffed by obliging and helpful personnel. There is a PC which can be used free of charge. The downsides were that, almost like being at home, if you want something you have to go and find it e.g. shower cap, shower gell - which are willingly dispensed at reception. When we were staying only Spanish TV was available: engineers were due to 'fix the antenna in the next few days'). Did I here manana? Oh and don't stay on a lower floor at the weekend because the hotel laundry is wheeled in and out noisily on the entrance marble floor at about midnight - much later than during the week apparently. This is a good place to stay, make no mistake. Just be prepared to have a few niggles along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern hotel, but a bit uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Eddie B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend last year for the night. It's a nice hotel but the lobby is probably the most impressive part. We stayed in a standard double room which I found to be slightly on the small side, and with open wardrobes and a harder than average (cheap) bed, I felt they had underspent on the furnishing of the rooms somewhat. It wasn't all bad though, the hotel is very well situated, the rooms are clean with great bathrooms and powerful showers. If you're on a budget and want a modern hotel, you wont go far wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking incident in hotel 987”
Reviews.Author: carole18a
Reviews.Content: Immediately after checking into my room 505, a small standard room, I opened the glass bathroom door and a large wooden panel above the door fell off, hitting the door and shattering the glass and then hitting me on the shoulder. My husband called for help, the desk clerk came and was more upset that the door was shattered than the fact that I had severe bruising and a small cut in my shoulder. There was no first aider on site, or even a first aid box. When we asked the for manager he was out to lunch. I was in shock and needed a glass of water so took one from the mini bar. The manager came after about 40 minutes and we were moved to another room. He apologised and assured me that anything I needed during our short stay was his pleasure. As we were only staying for 2 nights we went out for a while, upon our return, the blood stained towel and ice bucket that I needed to ice my shoulder were still in the room, which was very upsetting. The next morning the Manager stood next to me at the reception desk and did not even ask me how I was. After more than 24 hours the hotel insisted that I was seen by a doctor. The doctor came to my room, unaccompanied by any staff member, he did not speak English and was unaware why he was visiting me. Upon checking out the next day, we were presented with out bill, including the 2 Euros for the mini bar water. After some negotation we did not pay this bill. I found the hotel very lacking in any information on Barcelona, and the negligence and lapsydaisical attitude of the staff very upsetting. I would not visit any 987 Hotels ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Upscale”
Reviews.Author: oasis473
Reviews.Content: This was not my first choice but we saved $200 a night we would have spent at the OHM Hotel two blocks away. The hotel is clean, the bed comfortable, the breakfast plentiful and fresh, and the staff accommodating. The hotel is close to the main drag. On the main street everybody warned us about pickpockets so you be warned The only surprising item was that they don't have plugs in the room for US plugs and they were no plugs at the front desk, although Nicholas looked everywhere. Good job hotel 987 !

Reviews.Title: “very wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nada_nekorancova
Reviews.Content: I have spent a lovely city break in Barcelona past week. From its beggining we found a lot of positives about the location of the hotel etc. We got there using the bus from the aiport that stopped on the main street just in a short walkable distance from the hotel, the whole journey tooks about 20 mins. The staff on the reception were very friendly and they were more than helpful in giving us a directions and good tips about our trips. The breakfast time is great, they served the brf up to 11, so you can sleep a bit after a long walks in beautiful Barcelona city! The breakfast selection was quite ok,staff in the restaurant very kind and nice! Our room has been funky designed and very stylish - with a small teracce to the courtyard.The wifi was working properly all 5 days we spent there. They didnt have a printer in the computer room availible, but they print out what we did need at the reception. All at all, the hotel was nice, we like its style and the staff was really friendly and helpful - that all could help us to make our holiday even more adorable!I would definately recommend this hotel to all my family and friends on their trips to Barca!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: mary_gregoire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited 987 Baecelona for 4 nights. We enjoyed our stay . Hotel is conveniently located to metro (just a few block walk). Our room was nice, clean and breakfast was a good buffet. Restaurant and Hotel staff were accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Hayleyrigg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. A really nice, clean, funky designed hotel. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. It has a nice (again funky) bar. The breakfast was good (not excellent, but good). Well located off the main shopping street. I got off the Aerobus and walked with my bag - very easy to do, not taxi or metro needed! A little noisy with hearing doors closing at night, but most hotels seem to be. I travel a lot, quite critical I think but could not really fault this hotel, well priced and a really nice experience all round.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, nice, functional and good value for money ... but please change the staff!”
Reviews.Author: baol1969
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the Eixample. Great for business and leisure close to everything. The decor is really cute, modern stylish and functional. The common spaces and the rooms have the correct size. They are clean and in good (not perfect) shape. It is really an excellent stay. What lacks to earn the fifth star in the rating is the staff: they all do completely ignore the guests...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: maryf87
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in August for three nights, under an expedia deal ‘3 nights for the price of 2’, so wonderful value. The room was beautiful! Great size, beautiful design and the en suite was just gorgeous! It took us a while to figure out the air conditioning, but we got there in the end, very necessary for August! The location was great, between two subway stations. There were some nice restaurants and cafes close by. The service in the hotel was wonderful, very friendly at reception. There was 24 access and a porter who was very friendly. We didn’t opt to eat breakfast or dinner at the hotel (it seemed a bit pricey) but ate at places close by! We would definitely return, whether the room was on offer or not!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: markhusted
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on this hotel I was pleasantly suprised. I found none of the offhand staff or grubby rooms and overall I thought the hotel was really not so bad. Great breakfast friendly people and a lovely old building. Ok the rooms had a few marks and scars but nothing that would warrant a complaint. I would stay again and as boutique hotels go it was quite good value. Only downside not one english tv channel or movie and as a business traveller I need this.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: hillfam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights at the 987 for our anniversary. I had arranged in advance with the hotel to get a bottle of champagne in our room for our arrival. Due to our early arrival our room was not available so the hotel took our bags and we explored a little of the city. When we came back our room was available and had been upgraded to a room on the 7th floor with balcony overlooking the Carrer de Mallorca. Our champagne was on ice waiting for us to arrive and we thoroughly enjoyed it on the balcony taking in the views.The room was clean, modern and very comfortable. We found the staff helpful and friendly. The central location was great for getting around the city and we had a great time whilst staying at the hotel. One small issue was that bar was not open until 8pm but the 2 for 1 mojitos made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Libby P
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends stayed at this hotel for two nights celebrating one of the groups birthday. Was a bit concerned after reading mixed reviews but was pleasantly surprised The rooms were clean, modern and comfortable. Breakfast was included in our package and it was a good way to start the day with something suitable for all tastes. The location was great and easy to get cabs or the metro anywhere we needed to go. Staff were helpful. My only criticism is that the hotel bar did not open till 8pm. Too late for us but maybe saved us some cash! Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, polite and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: marcnmeg
Reviews.Content: As the last stop on the end of our trip we were very happy to have booked with this hotel. The rooms were average size for europe, clean and modern. The location was great as it was within walking distance from almost everything. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and with expiditing our room's readiness. We even got a free upgrade to a balcony room with a beautiful view of the cathedral. The bar was quiet on saturday night but very nice. Great accomodations for the price. I would recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rosebud699
Reviews.Content: First time in Barcelona - 987 is a good base to stay in very close to Sagrada Familia, La Pedera Casa Batllo and to links to tourist bus services. The hotel was well equipted but didn't have tea or coffee making facillties. we have one of the rooms on the 7th floor that had a balcony which was a plus. Did expect to have more choices in English TV channels as we only had BBC World Service. We did find most of the staff friendly and effiicient but a few did appear to find it difficult to remember their jobs involved customer service. We also had a cockroach in our room but the housekeeping staff dealt with this incident quickly and we were offered a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Frankly my dears, they didn't give a d....”
Reviews.Author: brockleyjames
Reviews.Content: Such potential wasted. A beautiful building in not a bad area of town. An impressive door swings open to reveal an equally impressive lobby. However from that point on we started to realise why the reviews on Trip Advisor weren't glowing, and why we should have listened to them. The problem with this 3 star masquerading as 4 star hotel is very simple: not one member of staff could really care less about their job, the guests or the hotel. The reception was staffed by a young man who was quiet to the point of rudeness; the rooms were tired, scuffed and marked, the cleaners had done an 'ok' job. If any one could be bothered this could be a great place; but the can't; and it isn't. On the up side the beds had clean sheets. All in all it is a 3 star hotel masquerading as a 4 star with a bad attitude

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: akorea
Reviews.Content: Booked online, no problem. Location is good in Mallorca Street, near the Sagrada Familia, Passeig Gracia and La Pedrera. Clean, spacious. Staff was helpful but not particularly friendly. Walls are stained. A bag of fine chocolates dissapeared from my room....Good hotel worth the recommendation despite these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: yuribf
Reviews.Content: They're not a 4-stars hotel. At best, a 3-stars. The service is the worst. I put the sign "not disturb" on the door and the staff enter the room; in 6 days I receive only 2 soaps (one in the begging and the other at the last day); the cardkey lost the code in 4 of the 6 days (have to go to the reception every time to get a new key); the staff don't even look at your face (except one of the female recepcionist); slammig doors all over the night (terrible sleep quality); there was a hugh spider in the room. I'm definetly not commig back. The good aspect: the internet connection worked well; the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: franceo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has modern funky furniture. The room and shower was clean. On the first night there were a few issues with the hotel WiFi (the hotel staff assured us they had reset it a few times). After the next day I was able to connect, but my husband wasn't. Even though the air conditioning said 15 degrees, it felt above that. I was expecting there to be carpet on the floor, but there wasn't. The hotel staff were very friendly. One of the days the cleaning people left the balcony window open - thus came back to a very hot room, when we wanted to escape from the heat. The hotel is within walking distance to Sagrada Familia - but everywhere else we caught a metro.

Reviews.Title: “great location-pity about everything else”
Reviews.Author: junbry
Reviews.Content: No kitchen hence no evening meal no tea/coffee maker-breakfast bought in -rubber scrambled egg-ossified bacon-nondescript sausage-melon and some pastries. Room clean and tidy -minimalist decor-wee bit odd.never ever a 4 star hotel. Also the taxi driver could not find it he thought that 987 was the street no. Altogether a very poor experience even with Segrada along the street

Reviews.Title: “Cool, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarrenandChris
Reviews.Content: When we made our booking we requested a room on a high floor with views of La Sagrada Familia and we were not disappointed! It was a spacious, modern room with an awesome bathroom. As we are smokers, the balcony is one of the most important things we consider when choosing a hotel room and the Barcelona 987 more than delivered in this area. The balcony was huge, overlooking quintessential Barcelona apartments with views down the street all the way to the cathedral. The 987 is in an excellent location within reasonable walking distance to many of Gaudi's highlights. Although it is centrally located, the streets seemed quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Kirill”
Reviews.Author: Ksh013
Reviews.Content: Very good area, there are no crowds of tourists around. Nice and big room with terrace.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a room a decent room cheaply, the hotel is okay.”
Reviews.Author: garveyc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located close to La Sagrada Familia and is a rather short walk to the historic Baric Gotic. There are many restaurants etc. nearby. As for the hotel itself, it is average at best. It is loud and the service is poor. They are not rude, but rather they sort of just don't respond. I would recommend this place to a person looking a cheaper clean hotel, but don't expect to be blown away.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant in appearance but quite basic”
Reviews.Author: queenofmarbella
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were fairly friendly - could have been more helpful. Bedroom for me and my husband had far too little hanging and shelf space in wardrobe and we hardly brought many clothes with us for a 3 night trip. Several lights in the room did not work and shower gel was not provided for 2 people and only on 2 of the 3 days. TV selection was not very good and room was far too hot and it was impossible to make it cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed. Lacking basics.”
Reviews.Author: nicstep25
Reviews.Content: I was expecting so much more when I read previous reviews of this place and was sadly disappointed. One review I read 'Style over Substance' really does sum it up. The designers have placed more emphasis on the flashy colours and furniture of the hotel rather than providing basic facilities. Room was ok, I felt it was on the small side and looked onto the back of another horrible grubby building but otherwise clean and comfortable. There was no full length mirror or other mirror than in the bathroom. The bare floor became cold in November and bed was small. We called for room service to be put through to a telepizza company (dominos type place) who got our order wrong, we felt Reception could of helped more with the language barrier there! I was also unimpressed that pizza was the only food offered at 10pm?? Drinks were expensive from the mini bar and the main bar was always empty. We felt like we were only ones staying there! Location is good, on same road as Familia and short walk to Passage De Gracia. Also the shower was lovely! Otherwise, I dont have many positives to report and I am not a fussy hard to please person. I just expect a certain level of service for my money which I didnt get.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: Jasonkonvacation
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all style over substance...lobby is hip, room colors are fun, but all the important things are lacking. Rooms are tiny, walls are thin(you hear everything, including every door that opens and closes), beds are singles pushed together...I stayed at an average Hilton last time I was in Barcelona and that average Hilton was head and shoulders above this hotel for the things that are important (nice beds, quiet, room size, etc.) I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: Paul11111111
Reviews.Content: A great hotel perfectly located midway between the Ramblas Shopping area and the Segrada Familia Cathedral. A modern and very colourful interior inside a listed exterior, the hotel offers clean comfortable rooms, a good breakfast, free internet computer and comfortable (yet quiet) bar. The rooms were unusual as the colour schemes extend to coloured glass screens to the ensuite facilities that aren't 100% private, being very picky though there was only limited hanging and storage space. All in all, this hotel is perfect for a weekend city break in a beautiful city, watch out for 'pick pockets'! Recomended to all, 10 out of 10 :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ExprncdTrvler3333
Reviews.Content: There are so many chic hotel selections in Barcelona that it was quite hard to figure out which one to stay at! I got a great deal on this hotel (under $100/night) and decided to stay here for 5 days. The hotel is in a great location! Only 3 blocks from Passeig de Gracia (which is a main street in Barcelona with tons of places to eat and shop). Barcelona has excellent public transportation so we were 2 blocks in either direction away from main Metro lines. It was a 10-15 minute walk to food and shops and and a 5-10 minute metro ride to the beach areas and the old town part of Barcelona. The hotel had a really neat and different design. It is in the quieter Eixample district where the buildings are older but all in good condition. You could tell this hotel has been completely renovated and there is a nice lobby/bar/lounge area. There is also a whole breakfast restaurant area where they serve breakfasts but at 14 euros /person/day we found food elsewhere. Our room and bathroom were HUGE for just a standard room and compared to most European rooms. It was VERY clean, very comortable (besides the bed being so-so, the shower had an awesome rain shower head, FREE Wi-Fi, and we had a pretty good selection of TV channels, however, they were mostly in Spanish. We had a view of nothing special but we could open our window/balcony and get some fresh air. The room was immaculate and the maids always did a great job cleaning the room. Overall I think this is an AMAZING hotel for the price that it is. If you are considering this hotel I would definitely book it. Other than the lobby staff being ....basically non-existent in the Hospitality department (which doesnt really bother me) I was so happy that I chose to stay here for my 5 day trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad...”
Reviews.Author: JMRif
Reviews.Content: Correct me if I'm wrong, but all decent hotels offer you a bed and a bathroom. What sets a hotel apart from another is the quality of the service offered by the establishment to the guests. Upon our arrival to the hotel, there was no one to greet us at the door, take our luggage after a long trip, just a lady at the reception desk who checked us in, took our luggage to storage and instructed us to wait for an hour and a half before our room was ready. We inquired on whether the hotel had a restaurant, as it was lunch time and we did not have enough energy to eat outside, and we were surprised to discover that the hotel had no restaurant, just a bar and a breakfast area. Upon checking in, the lady at the counter told us that we had a beautiful room on the seventh floor with a sea view. We took the elevator to the seventh floor, and upon leaving the elevator there was a really bad smell in the corridor leading to the rooms. The smell remained in that hallway during the entire period of our stay. As we entered our room, we looked out the window, and gazed at the buildings of the city spanning through the horizon and at the end of the stretch of buildings, not more than 2 cm of a blue line, that after focusing hard on turned out to be the sea. The room was tidy, bathroom clean, bed uncomfortable. There had been a take away menu for a pizza place on the desk in the room, and it said "room service". We asked for water to be sent up to our room one night, and the immediate response of the reception desk was "look in the minibar". After i told the man that we had already finished the water in the minibar, his answer was, "sorry sir we do not have room service, please come down to the hotel bar and buy your water". Enough Said ! 987 was a good place to stay because it was close to the main upscale street of Passeig de Gracia. The service in the hotel suggests that this is a place to come back at the end of a busy day and sleep. If you don't mind such an experience then this might be the hotel for you, on the other hand if you expect to be served and pampered during your vacation then go elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, bad service and decent location”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one weekend with my wife. We arrived with a late flight and when we came to the hotel the door was locked and no one could be seen inside. After a couple of minutes the receptionist came and buzed us in. Check in was swift, and that was great because it looked like the receptionist hated his job and us. No roomservice at 01 AM, so we had to go to bed hungry. The rooms are trendy and nice, but be aware that there is basically no closet space what so ever. Clean room and a really good "waterfall" shower. The next day we orderd roomservice, and got some microwaved pasta. If you stay here: do NOT order roomservice. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby. Locationwise you can find tonns of better hotels. Depends if you are in Barcelona for shopping, the beach or both. The beach is about 30-40 min away by foot, and to the major shopping areas it is about 15 min. Check out just concluded our feeling of not beeing welcomed. All in all, not recommended. There are several other hotels way better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: tourists_are_us
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. We upgraded to a room on the seventh floor with a terrace. We had a lovely view of Sagrada Familia. Paying the extra made a big difference to us as the room itself, whilst comfortable, was fairly small and the terrace allowed us to sit outside enjoy the good weather. Good points: The hotel could be found very easily from the Passeig de Gracia station. This station is approximately 20 minutes by train direct from the airport. As we arrived at night and did not know the city, having a easy to find location was important to us. The hotel was quiet - we kept the patio door open in the evening and there was some road noise but this was eliminated when the door was closed. We did not hear any other guests. The shower was hot and powerful. We had a large bed (kingsize) which is often difficult to find in smaller hotels in european citys. The room was kept clean throughout our stay. The staff were efficient and polite and our Argentinian barmaid was particularly pleasant. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as there were plenty of small cafes within walking distance. The hotel is near the stop for the tourist bus which is helpful to use on a first visit to get your bearings. Las Ramblas is a 10 -15 minute walk away. Less good points Our only slight reservation was the layout of the room. As others have mentioned, having the toilet separated from the bedroom by glass booth means that privacy is at a minimum. You certainly need to know the person that you share the room with well! Overall We were happy with our choice for this trip. Barcelona is a lovely, diverse and vibrant city. Perhaps if we went back we would choose somewhere slightly more central and if we stayed longer than a weekend we may find a larger room. That said 987 Hotel provided us with everything that we needed and we have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for seeing this beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: Travelkidd
Reviews.Content: We booked 987 Barcelona for a weekend getaway in January 2010 which included a birthday, an anniversary and our first trip to Spain. After some searching (including tripadvisor ratings) we booked 987 based on reviews and a 3 for 2 special (stay 3 nights for the price of 2). The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of La Pedrera, Sagrada Familia, Passeig de Gracia (major street) and La Ramblas. Three metro stations are a few blocks away. Hotel: the hotel is on Mallorca which is a quieter street with minimal noise. The onsite bar was always quiet, so much so that we never used our free drink tickets. Rooms: the rooms are modern and funky using clean lines and bright colours. We requested a bigger room and there was plenty of space. A small balcony (not large enough to use) opened to the back of other buildings so there wasn’t much a view. A bar fridge, TV, storage space and a comfy bed were included. The bathroom included a large overhead shower. We did use room service a few times and recommend the breakfast (1 serving fed 2 people easily) and the prices for chocolate dipped strawberries and cava are very reasonable. One item to note about the hotel and Barcelona in general is the lack of English speaking people – it just added to the fun! A little warning: we asked the front desk for a cab the first night and they happily called one. She noted that the driver would come and get us so we could relax in the foyer. They do this so the driver can come in and leave a tip/commission for the staff. We got our own cab the following night (you can easily get one by waving one down in front of the hotel) and found that the price was 3 Euros less for the same distance and street congestion. Definitely recommend this hotel and we’ll stay again when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Worth more than its price... wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: RalR
Reviews.Content: A beautifully designed room, gracious English speaking staff, wonderful breakfast and a great price. What more could you ask? We stayed in high-floor room with a balcony from which you could see the spires of Sagrada Familia ! The location is great, 2 minutes from the Verdegard metro station, 2 minutes from Gracia Blvd. (for shopping !) 10 minute walk (scenic stroll...) from Catalunja Plaza and a few minutes from Gracia Barrio (a must!). The only peave I have with the rooms is that the toilet door doesn't fully close (it isn't really a door...) so it doesnt afford too much privacy, so the squeamish might preffer going to the toilets downstairs... But this is made up for by the wonderful shower and great breakfast... Also, although there is free wi-fi, there was not enough reception in our room to use our iPhone...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NekiHalkis
Reviews.Content: Fantastic luxury hotel in the heart of Barcelona. Great rooms with all the extras facilities and the prices very normal for what you get...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: EllieGareth
Reviews.Content: If you're reasonably fit this hotel is in a great location, Rambla was only a 15 min walk away, and you're a stones throw from the main shopping road (also where some of the more famous buildings are). We even walked back to the hotel from watching FC Barca play, it took us about 45 minutes. Hotel is very clean, rooms were a tad small, but couldn't complain, tasteful decoration and enjoyed a new chocolate on our pillow every day! Interesting door to the bathroom....frosted glass door with a gap above and below - make sure if you're going with a partner you're at a stage where you're comfortable with each other! Would certainly stay in this hotel again, quite expensive - but Barcelona is pricey and for the money this is a fab hotel in a safe area and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere in this place!”
Reviews.Author: Favori
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here over New Years and had good time. Friendly young staff was always keen to help. Room was nicely furnished, spacious with nice and clean bathroom, minibar well equipped. Large terrace on first floor rooms but no chairs or sun beds. Beautiful bar and restaurant. Also breakfast dinner is nice with wide choices of food. Location is pretty central. Two blocks from main street packed up with restaurants, bars and leading to Rambla. Everything is in walking distance, you don't need taxi o metro. If you do need subway it is 4 blocks away as well as train express to airport. Free wifi Internet covering all hotel. The staff and hotel style and decorations make together very chill out atmosphere and special vibe in this place. Will not stay anywhere else when we are back in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location, in the heart of Gaudi's Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: Its location, 5 minutes walking to "La Pedrera", one of the most beautiful buildings from Gaudi and no more than 10 to the asthonishing "Sagrada Familia" cathedral make the hotel a rewarding place to explore modernist Barcelona. In addition, famous "Las Ramblas" is a short walk away, try to reach it through "Gracia St" , where all the luxury shoping (the likes of L Vuitton or Channel) as well as high jewellery are present. Window shoping is just another of the pleasures of the walking, although it is the wonderful modernist architecture and decor what pay the visit. Hotel rooms are beautifully decorated, in a singular minimalist style, with dark wooden walls and soft green douvets. Bathroom is huge, with both shower and bathtub in each room. Nice toiletries rounded up the experience. Rooms are quite big closer to the US standards more than europeans size. The rooms have also a "patio" like terrace, to enjoy Barcelona mild nights. All common areas (bar, breakfast room and restaurant) are very stylish. The outdoor terrace is perfect to enjoy and evening drink. Friendly staff and spotless cleanining just make the place a must.

Reviews.Title: “just avoid this pretentious hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ccrr77fr
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a city where it's pretty hard to make a choice for your hotel cause there are plenty of design and trendy hotels, some are really good but this time we really make the wrong choice... 987 Hotel is located in Eixample, not too far from Passeig de Gracia and at walking distance from Plaza Cataluna and let's just say this is the only positive point of this hotel we consider as stupidely pretentious... First of all, when we arrived, it was hard to find where was the entrance of the hotel. Nobody was available to help us with our baggages, not even to open the heavy door opening on a lobby quite colourful, maybe a bit too much, and very deep going to the reception where a girl seemed to be so busy... When we arrived in front of us, she kept working on something instead of saying "hello" which is totally unacceptable but anyway, in Europe, it's harder to find people really implicated in providing a fantastic level of service. Anyway, she gave us the key card after asking for the passeport and credit card and she told us that our room was located at the first floor without asking if we needed help... Moreover, i'm often questionning myself why people don't smile in some hotels... Why they didn't choose an other job cause when you're working in the hospitality industry, it means that you love contacts with customers... About the room, we have been chocked by the "flashy" colours used by the designer to decorate the room (turquoise blue and green apple...) and even more cause i've requested during the reservation process not to have a green room... Honnestly, it doesn't look good but at least, it gives light in a room, for sure with a terrace, but facing a old disguting building on the right, a wall on the left and the room of your neighbour right in front of... it means there is absolutely no privacy and if you leave the curtains opened, you can easily see what's happened in the next room... Consequently, it's absolutely not liveable and all you want is to leave the room. About the design, we were surprised about the wardrobe as well cause no door... it's not really good to see all your clothes when you're seated on the sofa or the bed... I don't know from which school is the designer but it's sincerely not nice... The bathroom was reasonnably sized with a seperate shower and bathtub but once again, some details of decoration are weird (a bunch of wood stalks full of dust just like as glass jar with plastic lemons in the bedroom...) and only one big towel for two is a bit limited... But maybe some people can like it but it would be surprising. The main problem comes from comfort... The noise is terrible meaning the soundproofing is disastrous. At each time somebody is going into a room, the door slaps strongly and wake you up. You have to deal as well with the noise coming from the ground of the upper floor and sleeping well is becoming a challenge... If you're lucky to find a good sleep, you'll be wake up early when the sun will appears cause the blind curtains don't blind anything... An other detail: If a lot of hotels are working about comfort, it's not the case at 987 cause the pillows are the worst we had and the matress wasn't good. Air con doesn't work properly (hard to be cool in the room) as well as the TV (it stops by itself...). Finally, let's talk about the maintenance and the housekeeping... Walls in the bedroom were full of splash; we found hairs around the toilet and in the bathtub; dust is everywhere... And in the common areas, even if the hotel is quite new, it seems to be aged already meaning the hotel choosed bad quality of furniture... So, NO service... A real lack of comfort... A pretentious and cheap design... and a cleanliness far from good make of this hotel an adress to AVOID and especially due to the extremly bad value for money...

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the crown of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Chinadol96
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk right into it. The service was not outstanding but relatively comparable to a good hotel in the states. The rooms are decent in size and some, as mine, have balconies that look onto the quiet street. I was thrilled to be Barcelona, by far my favorite city in Spain, and so far the only one worth re-visiting. This was my second tour of the grand metropolitan gem and I was once again left with a smile upon my face. That smile would soon disappear but at least I started out my trip with a bang. This hotel is worthy of every dollar you´ll spend here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experiance”
Reviews.Author: sony555
Reviews.Content: It is a fantastic well located design hotel and the staf are really very hepfull. There is a very good japanice restaurant called Japones very near the hotel. The Breakfast is fabolous and the bar is perfect for a cocktail. What I like the most was its free wifi and the free phone calls to fix EU numbers. I will go back when I visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: leilaportman
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel!!!Our suite on 2nd floor was so nice. Big, clean, with a huge bed. I liked the design of the bathroom very much. The breakfast really nice!!a big variety to choose what you like. I wish we have spent more time but we wanted to see the Barcelona. Service was great, very friendly and helpfull staff, I would definitely reccomend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A decent option for a few days in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Stakan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is overall nice. The design is attractive and the staff was extremely good - they were all very friendly and helpful. The location is a short walk from all the busy areas, but it is still tucked away in a very nice and quiet area. We didn't have the breakfast, as it seemed quite expensive. There are plenty of other options nearby. The free internet in the lobby was very useful, as we hadn't planned anything for the trip other than Barcelona and we used it to plan the next stage of our travel. However, it crashed several times, which was very frustrating. While the room was rather small, it was clean and comfortable. The only complaint was the mattress. My wife was fine with it, but I found it rather uncomfortable. I didn't sleep well on it and kept tossing and turning. Tip: The mussel restaurant next door was packed every night so we decided to try it on our last night. It was very good (if you like mussels of course)!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: FHKMacon
Reviews.Content: 987 Hotel is exactly what one might expect, if one browsed the website. Rooms are perfectly fine, clean and tended to by the housekeeping staff. There is also a certain attention to detail, seen in the dark chocolates left by the staff to grace your bed pillows in the evening, as well as the delicious breakfast buffet laid out each morning with staff who are quick to remove any dirty plates on your table. But what stood out most of all during our three night stay was Alexandra, the concierge who started each afternoon around 3pm. She was incredibly patient, taking the time to pull out maps and explain the location of various tourist attractions, restuarants, shops, etc. for each and every hotel patron....in impeccable English no less which was greatly appreciated. She made certain that each person was taken care of in the order they came to her with questions, being firm with patrons who tried to sneak ahead of those waiting in line. But what most impressed us was the time Alexandra took to assist us in obtaining train tickets to Valencia. She pulled up the train schedule on the internet and tried to arrange for our tickets. When that did not work, she spent countless minutes on the phone with the Barcelona train station trying to book our tickets. Without Alexandra at 987 Hotel, we would have had some difficulty getting around and out of Barcelona....as probably most guests of the hotel would have as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: trv30
Reviews.Content: Very good service and breakfast. Great location. Walking distance to Passeig de Gracia (3 min). Recomend this hotel for sightseeing or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amazing boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcrouton
Reviews.Content: Staid there for 4 nights in August 2009;. The hotel was great, in a good location right off the main drag. Had a great view of the Sagrada Familia from our little balcony. The staff was great and the room was the largest we had in two weeks of traveling in spain. Would definitly recommend staying here. The only complaint is my girlfriend missed a full length mirror.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: berryberg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Barcelona for the last 2 days of our honeymoon. It took me forever to book a hotel because I really wanted to make the right decision and researched hotels in Barcelona for months. I finally decided on 987 Barcelona and could not be happier. We booked a non-refundable room directly through the hotel website for about $150 per night. We arrived 6/30/09 which also happened to be the opening night of the U2 summer tour. We asked the front desk if they could help us get tickets. Our tickets to the concert were waiting for us 2 hours later and we paid face value! The front desk was so sweet to us from the moment we walked in. They locked up our luggage while we walked around the city (we arrived at 9am, check in is at 2pm). They provided us with a map of the city. When we got back to the hotel around 3pm, there was a chilled bottle of champagne waiting for us in our room! I ultimately chose this hotel because I do not want to be in a super touristy part of town but still wanted to be able to access these parts of town fairly easily. If you enjoy seeing the city on foot and prefer to have a hotel in a great part of town yet away from the hussle and bustle of Las Ramblas, this hotel is for you. The rooms were very clean, new, modern, comfy bed, mini fridge and an awesome shower. All the main city sights are a 15-20 walk and there are near by subway stations as well. If you like shopping Passeig de Gràcia is conveniently located within 4 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MarkM75
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in pretty much every way. The central location's brilliant - most things of interest in the city are no more than about a 15-minute walk away. And, if you don't fancy walking, there are a couple of metro stops nearby. Gaudi's Sagrada Familia is east along the same road (Carrer Mallorca). The hotel itself is very stylish - but not pretentiously so. As it only opened in 2007, everything feels brand new. All the public areas (including a cosy bar) are furnished and decorated in a very cool, colourful style. The twin room I stayed in was no exception - a mixture of dark wood, lime green, and white. There was a flat-screen TV, minibar, and a huge, amazing shower/wetroom which was separate from the rest of the bathroom. There was air conditioning - my only minor issue was that there was no way to control it yourself, although the centrally-set level was pretty good. Room access is by keycard, so if you're travelling with a friend, there's no problem getting two. The room was spotless - and cleaned every day (the cleaner even leaves you chocolates and a little card with the next day's weather forecast). There's free wi-fi - but, if you don't want to take your laptop on holiday, there are some Macs in quiet corners around the hotel for free internet access. The staff are superb - really friendly, and speak perfect English. I had a late flight home, so they were happy to look after my bags after I'd checked out. I'd thoroughly recommend this hotel - and I'll definitely be staying there again when I'm next in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great, funky, relaxed hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJ392
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 987 for 4 nights and had no complaints at all. Our room was a good size, real double bed (not 2 singles pushed together as happens so often), the bathroom was great with a bath and fantastic rain shower!! The maid service was perfect with a card each evening when the bed was turned down giving a weather forecast for the following day. It was extremely hot while we were there and looked forward to returning to our well air conditioned room. The decoration was lovely, really trendy and chic. The hotel bar was quiet but nice (best mojito I've had in a long time) and very reasonably priced. We only had breakfast there once delivered to our room and it was a feast for the price. The location is great for exploring the city and taxis there were really cheap (approx 20 euros from airport to hotel, 5-7 euros from beach to hotel). As mentioned in one of the other reviews, most taxis didn't know the hotel by name but of course, knew the address.

Reviews.Title: “modern characterful hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: ballynally
Reviews.Content: This hotel shows how to do it right. If you want to get away from the classic 1900- style hotels and not end up in an overtly modern and soulless place, this is for you.As some of the guests' pictures suggest, their choice of colour and building material is very good indeed. The lay-out of the lobby, bar and chill out room is well planned and spacious. There's a small room for internet too. The corridors have also smart bright colours in the windows, which gives an overall brightness. Our twin bed room overlooked the street, and was very nice indeed.Barcelona is a little noisy anyway, but with the double glazed window closed no problem. Mini bar was very handy.The staff is very friendly and helpful, without being either too formal or too inguisitive. 15 minutes walk to the Rambla, just out of the centre, everything easily reached. We stayed for 3 days and moved to another hotel, a building from the early 1900s, where you could easily bump into some expensive furniture and always had to ring the bell to get into the frontdoor. Too intrusive for my liking. Some of these hotels were never meant to be as such, so not very well planned and limited in space. (l'antic espai)

Reviews.Title: “Good service not so nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: vendervillej
Reviews.Content: I did not like the rooms, they werent comfortable for my wife and me, the bathroom was extremely small and so was the elevator and little things that i did not like.. In other hand the service was very nice, I had a very nice greeting and welcome from the staff, they value the costumer

Reviews.Title: “I'm loving it!”
Reviews.Author: Natipg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the 987 Barcelona Hotel in February just for one night and I loved it! The hotel is very well located, just in the city centre at a walking distance from the main attractions, shops, resturants and the main avenue, all in a high stading district, so can you save money on a taxi! If you can, book a superior room because, although you will have to pay a little more, is worthly it! Our room was very spacious, with lots of natural light, stylish, with views over the street but not noisy and a special area where relaxing while waiting for your partner/friends. The room had all kind of amenities with a very special attention to the bathroom, with bath and shower, guardrobe, etc. The buffet breakfast was very good, plenty of food, juices, biscuits, etc. And the service really charming, service and helful. If I come back to Barcelona I will stay at the 987 Barcelona hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Fotobear
Reviews.Content: I travel to Barcelona 3 to 4 times a year and have stayed in many a hotels here over the last decade. For my last visit I chose 987 because it seemed good value. I'd prefer to stay in Ribera or Born, but Eixample is actually much more convenient for my business appointments. Staff are very helpful - as soon as my taxi stopped outside, a porter was at hand. A parcel that had been sent to the hotel from my office was taken up to my room together with my luggage; I didn't even have to enquire about it first. (There are a lot of hotels where I am left to search for a parcel in a dusty cupboard.) Room size is adequate, though storage space is limited. My room looked out onto the backyard, and therefore straight into other rooms - which is why all the rooms on that side keep their blinds closed. Bathroom has a good size as well but could do with some deep cleaning. There were some ants running around looking for their lunch - on the 7th floor! At breakfast, I only had fresh fruit (pineapple, two kinds of melon) which were great. One of the most annoying 'improvements' to Spanish hotel breakfasts is the self-service coffee machine. 987 has one too. When I enquired whether it would be possible to have proper coffee I was pleased to hear that it was! So I got a 'cortado' from the bar instead of milky dishwater from the machine. 10/10 for the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern apartment style hotel rooms with a great balcony”
Reviews.Author: pez81
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Christmas and from what we could gather there was only us and another couple there. Lovely place could not fault, food lovely, staff brilliant and we got upgraded to 701 which has a great balcony and view of La Padera.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, colourful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahlucky13
Reviews.Content: Funky front door, opens into an impressive clean modern looking foyer. Staff were very helpful - not overly in your face but pleasant which we really liked. Room was a decent size with a high ceiling and we loved the fact it had a dummy balcony so you could get lots of fresh air. And the heavy duty blackout curtains were great! Big bed too, fairly firm which was very comfortable. Bathroom was very modern and the only down side is that the glass door is not a sealed door - so it's not able to lock. Maybe we're prudes but we didn't really like going to the loo.... (Although down in the foyer there are toilets which you can use - they look very dark and black but are nice and clean). Liked the nice little touches like a sponge for the bath and mini toothpaste. Breakfast was much more than we imagined for a Spanish hotel - nice choice and always room, not crowded at all but that could be the time of year we went (January) Overall I'd say it's a great hotel, great location - not right on top of things but with the grid system of streets easy to find yourself! From the airport the driver had to use a sat nav to find it - so make sure you take the address although I am guessing that this hotel will soon be well known enough for you not to need that!

Reviews.Title: “eskimo escape”
Reviews.Author: nfero
Reviews.Content: the customer service we had from the receptionists was good they tried hard too meet our needs. my brother was unwell on 2nd night they made sure they got the location of a 24 hour pharmacy and a cab to pop out and get some medication. the location was good it was easy to get to center and most attractions on foot. food ok but menu very limited not what i would expect of 4 star hotel. breakfast food ran out on two occasions well before time slot to have and had to request eggs and bacon this was a bit of a let down they did not seem to be able to plan or cope with the number of people they had booked in. the waitress in the main dining area and bar was very good great at her job and need to congtraulated...she also trebled up to do room service delivery rushed off her feet! the room was a let down i was told there were English tv stations but only cnn was available the programmes of english origin were all dubbed into spanish........tourists of non-spanish origin were not expected? the hotel advertises a money changing facility i asked for this twice but was told they were not able to do this as it was the holiday-time....bit of a funny response a loads of tourists had booked in and travelled to Barcelona. news-papers all in spanish. room was a disaster it was freezing,on complaining was told panel at desk indicated temp was ok so room shoul be warm i insisted on having an extra key to heat up room when i was away but this did not help......no attempt was made to check my heating out as out was out of hotel for the day....would have thought they would have as i complained. next stage 2 lights not working and lights that did would not turn off as well as heating not working bell/boy came up fiddled around and suggested turning off lighting to isolate problem all this occured at about 1 a.m after night out and coming in from rain i asked if i could have room that had heating proven to work and lights working but was not given one.....maybe something lost in translation but i stated i did not expect to pay full bill as felt hotel was poorly maintained. next morning at check -out met with surprise about my asking for bill to be reduced,manager said it could not be done as i could have changed rooms and refused to......clearly something lost in translation......being of sub-saharan descent choosing to sleep in igloo is not something i would have done by choice....that was lost on her. The heavily pregnant manager that was on duty either used her pregnancy as means of getting out of dealing with the issue or was just not fit to discharge her duties but started rubbing her tummy and wincing and ran to the toilet mid-conversation .....maybe thats another health and safety issue 987 should look into. paid in ful......will contact Expedia agents i booked through. 987 has some work to do....Barcelona has many hotels that are centrally located and that put the health and safety of their customers first. sorry customer service from manager,poor leadership let the hotel down can see why they have let themselves down,others worked hard....but need to be managed by someone on the ball,aware of customers needs who lnows about healtha nd safety issues and is in a condition to discharge their duties. these are basics... Dont go to 987.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, but didn't enjoy”
Reviews.Author: deepballer
Reviews.Content: My wife an I started our honeymoon in Barcelona and stayed at 987 for 4 nights prior to going on a med cruise.. While the hotel was nice and modern, we didn;t enjoy it that much. It was close to some shopping areas and local restaurants, which was a plus. We ended up enjoying the La Ribera area much better and stayed there when we returned for one night. I would recommend our last hotel, the Grand Hotel Barcelona, as the room was much larger and location more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but Hot Hot Hot”
Reviews.Author: AdamJGodden
Reviews.Content: Date: 25th August 2008 We went out to Barcelona and stayed for one week at the beautifully stylish 987 Barcelona. The welcome was Luke warm although I think it was just an end of a shift for this particular person as the staff were friendly and helpful once we had settled in. The room on first impressions was very stylish and had all the bits you needed to survive including the extortionately priced mini - bar! All seemed well until the first nights sleep and it dawned on me and my partner the foreign migrant with only one lung up in the roof space did not seem quite adequate air conditioning for the top floor sauna we were staying in... at least I lost some weight this week! This seemed to change into Siberia when you went down into the bar and dining room areas (I kid you not my girlfriend asked for a jumper when it was 35 degrees outside!). This aside these areas were very stylish and were actually quite nice to relax in after you had been out all day. The menu and food there seemed ok I only tried this once as we eat out elsewhere most of the time just abit of a limited choice but very nice and well presented. the location by far is the best asset of this hotel it was nearby to a metro which could get you to anywhere in Barcelona or if you wished most things were within walking distance tops walk was an hour walk to the zoo although we did find we went the long way round! (PS it's very easy to get lost here get a MAP!). If you or your partner are retails addicts and you want a bit of high class shopping then this is ideal for making you bankrupt as it is only a mere ten minute walk until you find you have no money for your holiday after one purchase at GUCCI, LOIUS VITTON or other names of such indulgence. I would recommend that you look up the restaurants before you go out to Barcelona there are some really nice ones but there is a lot of tosh that makes Mac Donald’s look like a gourmet restaurant! The good one's seem to be scattered about and not always on the main streets so don't be afraid to have a wonder as you might find some real gems like we did. One I do recommend is LA BO TIGA there are a few of these they are reasonably priced very stylish and the foods really good too which is a bonus! Overall I would recommend this hotel just try not to get a top floor room as these are really hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Star1405
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the 987 for one night on business - real shame I couldn't stay there longer. Hotel was immaculate as were the rooms. I stayed in a corner room with floor to ceiling balcony doors. The room and bathroom were super modern, tidy, clean. The hotel staff were helpful and breakfast was fine. It was really fun staying in this hotel and the decor was so intruiging and very cool! In addition the location was central and easy to get to and from places.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: pete32
Reviews.Content: Took the company away for a weekend break and chose the City of Barcelona as wanted to take full advantage of its famous club scene. searched high and low for a modern feeling and boutique hotel and all I can say is that we hit the jackpot with 987. Behind the classical facade of an old building in this fabulous district lies a stunny renovation into a modern contempory hotel. This hotel greatly reminds me of the sanderson hotel in london. Clean, modern, contemporary and in a good location I cant recall one complaint or grumble from any of the 10 guests we had stay that weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flydanair
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located being only a 10 minute walk to the Ramblas area (down the Passeig Gracia where a lot of designer shops are) so you get all the benefits of being centrally located but are away from the main hustle and bustle of the bars on the Ramblas which will be noisy into the night. The hotel entrance is decorated to a very high standard and the staff on reception were very friendly and informative and each night we stayed booked us into the restaurants we wanted to eat at. The room to be fair was on the small side (and i had booked an executive room on the top floor - 7th) but came with a large balcony, a very good sized shower in the bathroom and was well decorated, but it would have been better to have slightly bigger rooms. There was free wi-fi available and a computer to use free of charge in the reception area. I think the price was fair for the standard and quality of the hotel and I would be happy to stay again. All in all i think the only negatives were the smaller sized rooms and the lack of an available iron (which is something of a personal must with me!! - so i bought one)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent -just right”
Reviews.Author: MacSver
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. I first visited in September 2007, with ‘the lads’ to see The Police gig at the Olympic Stadium. The fact that I returned, with the wife, (apart from my credit card), obviously reveals my positive experience staying at 987 Barcelona. First off, the location. Situated in the affluent Eiample area (guys, with wives/girlfriends beware), all the major sights are easily reachable from the excellent and easy to use Metro. Turn right out of the hotel door and you are only a few blocks away from The Temple de la Sagrada Familia. Turn left out of the door and you are a short walk from the Passeig de Gracia, which leads to the Plaza Catalunya. Reaching the hotel from the airport via public transport is very easy. Directions are available from some of the other reviewers, so I won’t repeat them here. The hotel itself is very clean, stylish and on both occasions I have found the staff both very friendly and helpful, with a good standard of English. The rooms are well appointed, in keeping with the hotel style. Everything you’d expect from a hotel of this grade. The cleaning staff could be a little overenthusiastic at times with their vacuuming in the corridors, but they redeemed themselves with the excellently turned-down rooms. A nice touch (including the obligatory the chocolate mint) was the little card indicating the weather forecast for the next day! Some reviewers have commented on the glass door leading to the en-suite bathroom being a tad indiscrete. There was no lock in both the rooms I’ve used, and there was a small gap around the glass door. Frankly, I can’t see the problem. Get the fan going from the aircon – it’s noisy and, um, does the trick. I could see this as a very minor grumble for those of a more private nature! But apart from that, everything else was fine. The rooms have air-conditioning which I found to be effective in both the rooms I used. Mini bar has water, if arriving late, and not too extortionate. The bar now opens to midnight. Also, very useful – the hotel has a free left luggage facility. Reception provides a free city map, which is actually very good, if you don’t already have one. Breakfast is optional. If you want breakfast at the hotel, simply turn up, give the attentive staff your room number and help yourself to an excellent range of hot and cold options, drinks, cereals, fruits and pastries. You can even make up yourself a full, um, ‘British’, if you know what I mean! It’s in the laid back dining area that you actually see other guests…the place is an oasis from the city hubbub; clientele tends to be usually Europeans, from business to families. JUST ARRIVED? Tips for Barcelona virgins…for orientation from hotel; Where to eat on arrival; take a left out of the hotel, a few blocks on takes you to the Passeig de Gracia (the busy road, 5 mins walk away). Head one block more and you’ll be on La Rambla Catalunya; up or down you’ll be spoilt for choice. For all budgets, any time of day. Eat outside, or inside. Recommended to get you started. Metro; get yourself a 10 hop ticket, available from the machines (cash and credit cards), and go! Once you’ve fed a card through a barrier, the trip is printed o the back of the card, so you know how many are left. NOTE: the airport train is also covered by this ticket (excellent) so hop on at the metro, Paseo de Gracia, but as this is a real ‘train’ it’s not as frequent as metro…about every 40 mins, from my experience. Still bloody good! Note: the airport train at Paseo de Gracia has a good half metre gap from carriage to platform…less enabled be aware. First trip; Parc de Montjunic: From hotel start at the Paseo de Gracia metro, get off at Paral-lel. Follow the signs within the station. Take the funicular (free); arrive. Turn right, up ramp and take cable car – highly recommended, or left, Olympic stadium – free view inside. I’ll leave the rest to your discretion, as by now you’ll know how easy it is to get around! I hope this helps. Barcelona is a great city, and I’ve had two excellent trips there, no problems and very relaxing. The hotel, for me, was just right.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Fab Fab!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonPoodles
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through LastMinute.com. We printed off a map so had no trouble finding the hotel and it's only a 10 minute walk from Passieg de Gracia metro station and about 10-15 from Sagrada Familia. The hotel is in a lovely area so as two females we had no worries about walking to the hotel at night. The hotel was lovely and clean, very minimalist and funky but very warm and welcoming at the same time. The staff were great and very willing to offer any help they could. The room was impecibly clean, i always check under the beds and there was no dust to be seen anywhere :). we also had a balcony which offered a lovely view of Sagrada - we were on the 5th floor so not sure what views are like on other floors. We also checked out the other floors to find the are all lit in a diferent colour scheme, ours was pink but there is also green. orange and lilac. The only little complaint i has was that the glass door to the bathroom doesnt block out a lot of noise so you can hear everything thats going on in there.... not always a good thing!! Other than that, I cant recommend it enough and wouldn't dream of booking any where else but here if i return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap lounge”
Reviews.Author: Aurore57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located (10 min from the Placa de Catalunya and 3 min from the tube), in a great area of Barcelona. Although the rooms' decoration is quite nice with a "lounge" touch, we were rapidely estonished by some disturbing points: every morning we were woken up by the vacuum cleaner hiting the door, and the bed was very very hard. We heared all noices from the corridor. Moreover, no wifi except on ground and first floor. Prices quite high for a very medium quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidayangel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with alpharooms.com as I found they offered the cheapest rate. Check in at the hotel was very quick and smooth, although it took us a while to find the hotel, I had hoped some one might have put directions on here so it would have been easier to find... so here goes for people who would like to know. Get the A1 aerobus (blue) from the airoport to Placa Catalunya (4euros), then get the metro to Diagonal. When you come out of there you'll see "La Padrera Espai Guadi", go down two blocks from there and just after Louis Vuitton take a left onto Mallorca, walk two blocks down and there's the hotel on your right. The hotel was cool and stylish and in a very good location. It's in the Eixample district, which is quite a rich area hence, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Armani. But this seems to mean there's no pickpocketing and not too many beggars around and the streets are well lit at night. The Ramblas is nice to have a look, but wouldn' stay there as there are so many tramps and beggars praying on the tourists! Avoid talking to anyone that looks dodgy and keep an eye on your belongings especially on the metro and around the rambla area. It's very crowded and people seem to be looking for an easy target! We had a room on the top floor, not a great view, but then I didn't go to Barca to look out my hotel window! The room was clean and tidy, the maids did a great job. They put a choc on you pillow about 6ish and leave tomorrow's weather forcast! The best way to see the sights is on the Bus Turistic, 20euros pp for one day. There's three routes, blue, red and green. Green doesn't run in the winter months though. It's an open top hop on hop off bus tour. Great photo opportunities as it takes you to all the sights! If you take a right out of the hotel and keep walking you'll get to Sagrada Familia. There's a park at the front, which is nice for photos and a sit down, again be carful of beggars, we saw them surround one bench and the tourist had to give them money to make them leave them alone! The woman beggars seem to have scarves on their heads and there's children ones too. They carry a folder so they look like students! If you see them walk away, and don't make eye contact! All in all, we had a fab time, the hotel choice and location made it fab! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: claire73
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. It was clean, modern and the staff were friendly. We found the location absolutely perfect - it was quiet although we were at the rear of the hotel. Our room had air conditioning and a safe. I was most impressed by the cleanliness. Breakfast was fabulous, lovely food. We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on that. There is so much to see and do in Barcelona you will probably not be in the hotel that much anyway! Three Gaudi 'greats' are an easy walk away - Casa Battlo, Casa Mila and the Sagrada Familia and everything else is easily reached using the metro, also nearby. We would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault hotel, but very poor service and cold rooms”
Reviews.Author: Janiecakes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice inside and is located in a fantastic area just of one of the main streets of barcelona. However, try and get a drink after 10.30pm, or even a drink at 10.30am!!! The service is diabolical, and they seemed to be short of staff. The rooms had temperature control which didn't seem to work, so you were constantly cold. It wasn't just me either....I was staying there in a group of 10 (a Hen weekend) and we all felt the same way about the service and the room temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GulfWanderer
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in the 987 Barcelona via Splendia's website. The main reason we booked via Splendia was that they took the first night's room charge upfront and their website clearly states that every room booking is therefore guaranteed and that there will not be any overbooking. When we arrived at the hotel just before midnight after a long train journey from Paris, the Receptionist told us that there is a problem with our room and they needed to book us out to another hotel. My wife and I both work in the hotel industry ourselves and it wasn't so much the being booked out we minded but the fact that the Receptionist used the oldest lie in the book and told us that there is no hot water in our room. At the same time, other guests were being checked into their rooms by her colleague. They, of course, were corporate travellers and probably paid a higher rate.
